name: Hydrogen
description: Hydrogen is the most abundant element in the universe, and powers stars through nuclear fusion

name: Helium
description: Helium is the second most abundant element in the universe

name: Boron
discoverer: Loui-Josef, Gay-Lussac and Louis-Jacques Thénared in Paris, France. Humphry Davy in London, England.

name: Oxygen
discoverer: Joseph Priestley, Wiltshire, England. Carl Wilhelm Scheele (independently) in Uppsala, Sweden

name: Neon
discoverer: Sir William Ramsey and Morris Travers

name: Argon
discoverer: Lord Rayleigh and Sir William Ramsey

name: Bromine
discoverer: Antoine-Jérôme Balard in Montpellier, France and Carl Löwig in Heidelberg, Germany

name: Krypton
discoverer: Sir William Ramsay and Morris Travers

name: Xenon
discoverer: Sir William Ramsay and Morris Travers

name: Cerium
discoverer: Jön Jacob Berzelius and Wilhelm Hisinger

name: Promethium
discoverer: Jacob A. Marinsky, Lawrence E. Glendenin and Charles D. Coryell

name: Holmium
discoverer: Per Teodor Cleve at Uppsala, Sweden. Independently by Marc Delafontaine and Louis Soret in Geneva, Switzerland

name: Lutetium
discoverer: Georges Urbain in Paris, France. Independently by Charles James in New Hampshire, USA

name: Hafnium
discoverer: George Charles de Hevesy and Dirk Coster

name: Rhenium
discoverer: Walter Noddack, Ida Tacke and Otto Berg

name: Astatine
discoverer: Dale R. Corson, Kenneth Ross MacKenzie, Emilio Serge

name: Berkelium
discoverer: Stanley Thompson, Albert Ghiorso and Glenn Seaborg

name: Californium
discoverer: Stanley Thompson, Kenneth Street, Jr., Albert Ghiorso and Glenn Seaborg

name: Nobelium
discoverer: Georgy Flerov and colleagues and at Dubna near Moscow. Independently by Albert Ghiorso and colleagues at Berkeley, California

name: Lawrencium
discoverer: Georgy Flerov and colleagues and at Dubna near Moscow. Independently by Albert Ghiorso and colleagues at Berkeley, California

name: Rutherfordium
discoverer: Georgy Flerov and colleagues and at Dubna near Moscow. Independently by Albert Ghiorso and colleagues at Berkeley, California

name: Dubnium
discoverer: Scientists at Berkeley, California and Dubna in Russia

name: Bohrium
discoverer: Peter Armbruster, Gottfried Münzenberg and colleagues

name: Meitnerium
discoverer: Peter Armbruster, Gottfried Münzenburg and colleagues

name: Darmstadtium
discoverer: Sigurd Hofmann, Peter Armbruster and Gottfried Münzenberg

name: Flerovium
discoverer: Scientists at Dubna, Russia and the Lawrence Livermore National Laboratory, California, U.S.A.

name: Moscovium
discoverer: Scientists at Dubna, Russia and the Lawrence Livermore National Laboratory, California, U.S.A.

name: Livermorium
discoverer: Scientists at Dubna, Russia and the Lawrence Livermore National Laboratory, California, U.S.A.

name: Tennessine
discoverer: Scientists at Dubna, Russia, the Lawrence Livermore National Laboratory, California, U.S.A. and Oak Ridge National Laboratory, Tennessee, U.S.A.

name: Oganesson
discoverer: Scientists at Dubna, Russia and the Lawrence Livermore National Laboratory, California, U.S.A.
